name: Hotel Solimar Inn Suites

reviews.title: Good price very clean!
reviews.text: I stayed here with 3 other friends for a whole week. This is not the place if you want beach views, sunsets and beach/sand within walking-distance. But !, if you want a spacious, comfortable, very clean (the bed sheets are as white as those in detergent commercials!!), and you have a car to move around, then stay here!! If you are going to cook, bring your own knifes, other than that the kitchen fed four people 2 meals a day with no problem. If they add some strong colors to the walls it would look awesome!

reviews.title: Great Zihua hidaway
reviews.text: We booked at the Solimar through the web, intending to shop around for a better deal once we got there. In the end, we did not find anything as pleasant, clean, or comfortable for anything near the price (though there were lots of worse places; prices have gone up all along the coast). We liked the fact that this quiet hotel with its private pool was a short walk from the bustling town centre and close to Playa Madera, though we mostly took cheap cabs or combis to the farther beaches or buses from town to Ixtapa. Edison, the manager, was helpful and prompt in dealing with our requests. The apartment was spacious and comfortable. The kitchen is for whipping up simple foods, not for serious cooking. The pool was a hit with our five-year-old and a nice place to chill with a beer while deciding where to go eat.

reviews.title: Thanks for the tip, very nice petit hotel!
reviews.text: I picked the Solimar because of the reviews I read in internet -including tripadvisor- and after a visit to their website. Booked for a week to tried it out but ended up staying three weeks... my whole vacation. Why? - The place it's as described, nice large and clean rooms (suites), great friendly hosts, a relaxing pool and more. Every night I had my tequilas sitting at the balcony overlooking the small park while enjoying the great weather and the real Mexican atmosphere -mmmmhhhhh, I'm missing it already!- This was my first trip to Zihuatanejo and I felt in love with the place - Solimar is my lodging choice for my future trips, hope they will a have room for me! Carl

reviews.title: Loved the place!!!
reviews.text: Great little hotel, large suites, very clean, kitchenette for my morning coffee, cable TV (but few english speaking channels thou), nice ambience. Very friendly and helpful owners (a whole family). I'll go back for sure!!!

reviews.title: Like going home
reviews.text: Nice family run hotel, in truth they are small apartments. Everything you need for a relaxing vacation. Just a tiny bit shabby, BUT very very clean! Excellent maid service, Lovely pool. good location just a few blocks from El Centro & Playa Madera. A real middle class Mexican neighborhood with very friendly people. Overlooks a small park. all rooms have at least one balcony & my Fav has two. AC, celing fans, TV (mostly Espanol) kitchenette. One thing that bugs me is a coffe pot & toaster are extra, "Come on Edison they have to be paid for by now!" A very good value with discounts for stays over 7 days.

description: Four level Mediterranean style building with 12 comfortable and nicely decorated suites of 430 and 540 square feet. (40 and 50 m2) plus terrace area. Ideal for short or long vacations for couples and families. English spoken and the property is family owned and operated. Services include: Kitchenette, A/C, Cable TV, Phone, Wi-Fi, Pool and much more. Allow us to give you our personal and friendly attention. We are considered a "Hotel with Charm".
